body:
@jbuberel your description is a bit complex.

In Go 1.X is a major release and 1.X.Y is a minor release.  There is no need to make "1" a variable.

We don't update minor releases. We update major releases. Each update is itself a minor release. 1.4.3 is the second update to 1.4, not an update to 1.4.2.

For critical security patches, we update the current and previous major releases. (That update takes the form of a minor release for both.)
